properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:57 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-08T20:34:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T17:57:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3748151322.2020
Area: Saint-Hyacinthe - Acton Vale area, Saint-Jean - Marieville area, Drummondville area, Granby - Waterloo area, Brome-Missisquoi area, Richmond area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain this afternoon and possibly into early this evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T23:59:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T17:09:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0929768583.2020

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. ### Tornado watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce tornadoes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-08T22:19:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T18:51:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0427137952.2020
Area: City of Toronto

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of hot weather is expected. Daytime high temperatures in the low thirties will begin today and will continue through the end of the week. Overnight low temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius will provide little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T08:46:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T16:47:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4130876441.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The oppressive heat wave continues A warm and humid air mass over Southern Quebec will continue over the next few days. Temperatures will exceed the 30-degree mark during the day and will not drop below 20 degrees at night. Combined temperature and humidity values will produce humidex values of 40. These conditions are expected to persist through Saturday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T11:28:56-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Potential rainfall rates: possibly in excess of 25 millimetres per hour. Potential wind gusts: possibly in excess of 90 km/h. Locations: Edmundston and Madawaska County, Grand Falls and Victoria County, and western Restigouche Countiy. Time span: This afternoon into this evening. Remarks: Conditions are favourable for thunderstorms approaching from the northwest this afternoon. Conditions may become severe late this afternoon into this evening. The highest threat is for strong wind gusts, followed by local heavy downpours. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T01:45:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T16:53:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2832688566.2020
Area: Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Winds will continue to strengthen during the day with gusts up to 100 km/h expected this afternoon. Winds will then diminish early this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-09T04:59:33-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:04 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-08T21:34:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-08T19:04:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4225661159.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 2:57 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. At 2:57 PM, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. The thunderstorm is northwest of downtown Toronto and may give 50 to 70 millimetres of rain over the next hour. Wind gusts up to 100 kilometres per hour are likely on the west side of Toronto. There is also the risk of a tornado with this severe thunderstorm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads.
